H0.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Geometric Pattern

H1.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Islamic Art

H2.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Stained Glass

H3.text: Tessellation technically refers to which form of decoration. Tiling/mosaic

A4.text: In Latin, tessella is a small cubical piece of clay, stone, or glass used to make mosaics.

A5.text: Historically, tessellations were used in Ancient Rome and in Islamic art such as in the Moroccan architecture and decorative geometric tiling of the Alhambra palace.

A6.text: Tessellation, the mathematical analysis of covering a surface or higher-dimensional object with geometrical shapes

A7.text: The best way to arrange variously shaped tiles on a surface leads to the mathematical field of tessellation.

A8.text: Opus regulatum: A grid; all tesserae align both vertically and horizontally.
